translated: Volume 2 of the Comprehensive Records of the Successive Generations of Buddhas and Patriarchs
Dazhong Xiangfu Chan Monastery in Jiaxing Prefecture
Collected by Huating Nianchang, the abbot
The ancient lords are the ultimate of the utmost.
Ancient means now.
Jun means ruler.
Baihu Tong.
Means many.
The focus of the many below is one. The first lord of Pangu ruled for 18,000 years. Liezi says:
Yun is Pangu.
Beishan says:ğŸ”½The sky is one zhang high.
The earth is one zhang thick.
Pangu is one zhang tall.ğŸ”½His head reaches the east.
His feet reach the west.ğŸ”½His left hand reaches the south.
His right hand reaches the north.ğŸ”½Opening his eyes is dawn.
Closing his eyes is night.
Calling is heat.
Breathing in is cold.ğŸ”½Exhaling becomes wind and clouds.
Breathing out becomes thunder and lightning.
The four seasons follow.
All things are born.
The vastness of the eight directions and nine boundaries.
Who can compare with many?
The Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors,
Who can be considered more venerable than them?
The ancient and modern records say that after Pangu died, his body divided into various things.
Second, the Heavenly Sovereign Clan.
One body with thirteen heads.
Wei Zhao said:
Thirteen brothers.
Dividing the land to rule, each for 18,000 years.
The ancient and modern records say:
The Heavenly Sovereign had one body.
With thirteen heads above.
Third, the Earthly Sovereign Clan.
One body with eleven heads.
Wei Zhao said:
Eleven brothers.
Ruling for 11,000 years.
The Imperial Calendar says:
9,000 years.
Some say the Three Sovereigns all ruled for 18,000 years.
Fourth, the Human Sovereign Clan.
One body with nine heads.
Wei Zhao said: Nine brothers.
Governing the Nine Provinces.
The Imperial Calendar says:
4,500 years.
The Human Emperor reigned for sixty-five generations.
For forty-five thousand six hundred years.
The Five Dynasties, the Five Dragons, and the Five Clans.
Reigned for two hundred and seventy thousand three hundred and sixty years.
At that time, people ate leaves and lived in nests.
The Sheti Dynasty had seventy-two clans.
Reigned for six hundred and forty-nine thousand five hundred and twenty years.
The division of day and night, time, and the lunar month began.
The moon was made of a jade rabbit and toad.
The golden crow had three legs.
It rose in the Fusang tree and set in the Xiumu Pool.
The He Xiong Dynasty had three clans.
Reigned for sixty-three thousand years.
The Lian Jing Dynasty had six clans and reigned for sixty-nine thousand years.
Wei Zhao said:
Thirty-two thousand years.
The Xu Ming Dynasty had four clans.
Reigned for forty thousand years.
The Yu Clan.
The hundred generations did not record the years.
The rites say:
In ancient times, the sage kings had no palaces.
In winter, they would dig out caves.
In summer, they lived in tree nests.
They did not yet have fire.
They ate the fruits of plants and trees, and the meat of birds and beasts.
They drank blood and ate raw meat.
Seventh, the Sui Ren clan.
They drilled wood to make fire.
The Rites say:
Roast millet and cut up pork.
The commentary says:
In ancient times, there were no cauldrons or steamers.
They selected rice and pork and cooked it on heated stones.
The Ancient and Modern Records say:
Ruling with the virtue of wood.
Reigned for 80,000 years.
From the beginning of ancient times.
The four seasons were already in order.
The length of day and night.
Distinction arose at this time.
The Book says:
One year has 366 days and 6 days.
Using intercalary months to determine the four seasons and complete the year. The celestial body is most round.
It encircles 365.25 degrees.
Circling the earth to the left.
Always one day to circle and pass one degree.
The sun is slow when it reaches the sky.
Therefore, the sun travels one day and also circles the earth once.
But in the sky, it does not reach once.
Accumulating 365 days and 940 minutes, it meets with the sky after 235 days.
This is the number of days the sun travels in a year.
The moon is even slower in the sky.
Every day, it does not reach the sky by 13 degrees and 19 minutes and 7 minutes.
Accumulating 29 days and 940 minutes, it meets with the sun after 499 days.
Twelve meetings get a full day of 348 minutes.
Plus 5,988 minutes, which is the same as the sun's method.
940 minutes divided by 6 does not exhaust 348 minutes.
The total gets 354 days and 348 minutes.
This is the number of months the moon travels in a year.
A year has twelve months.
A month has thirty days.
The 360 days are
the constant number of one cycle.

Therefore, when the sun meets with the heavens and has five extra days, 940/60 days, it is 235 days of the year. When the moon meets with the sun and lacks five days, 940/60 days, it is 592 days of the month, which is the emptiness of the new moon, and the intercalary month is born.
Therefore, in one year, the intercalary month rate is 827 days of 940/60.
In three years, one intercalary month is 32 days of 940/60.
In five years, two intercalary months are 54 days of 940/60.
In nineteen years, seven intercalary months are the qi and suan division.
This is one chapter.
Therefore, if three years do not have an intercalary month,
then the first month of spring enters summer,
and the seasons gradually become uncertain.
The first month of zi enters chou.
And the year gradually becomes incomplete.
Accumulating it for a long time, up to three lost intercalary months,
then spring all enters summer,
and the seasons are completely uncertain.
The twelfth lost intercalary month,
the child all enters the rat,
and the year is completely incomplete.
The Zhongyong of the Three Emperors says:
Huang means great.
Internally and externally non-action,
using the Way to transform the people.

Mother named Hua Xu.

It is also called.
Pao Xi.

The method is called Huang Mu, virtue, capital Chen Liu, commandery Xia Huang county boundary, in power.
One hundred and ten years.
First painted the eight trigrams.

Writing was created to replace the knotted ropes system. From this, written records were born. Marriage was established - a woman marrying is called giving in marriage, a man marrying is called taking a wife. Nets and traps were made to catch fish.
The Er Ya says: Bird snares are called nets.
Fish traps are called wicker baskets.
Rabbit snares are called snares. The twenty-five-stringed zither was created, seven chi and two cun long, eighteen chi wide. NÃ¼wa's surname was Feng.
She was Fuxi's sister.
She was able to transform myriad things. She created the sheng reed organ, four chi long.
Pipes are placed in gourds.
The larger ones have nineteen reeds, the smaller ones have thirteen reeds.
There are thirty-seven stalks.
The reeds are four chi and two cun long.
They are made of bamboo.
Their shapes vary like bird feathers. She refined five-colored stones to repair the torn sky.
She cut off the tortoise's feet to establish the four poles.
She reigned for one hundred and forty years.
Gonggong Shi, Danting Shi, Baxuan Shi, Zhongyang Shi, Luli Shi, Lielan Shi, Xuxu Shi, Zunlu Shi, Hunhun Shi, Hao Ying Shi, Geting Shi, Zhu Xiang Shi, Yin Kang Shi, Wu Huai Shi.
A total of fifteen generations.
A total of 17,787 years.
Not recorded in the classics and histories.
9. The God of the Altar - In ancient times, the Gonggong clan had a son.
Called Houtu.
Able to level the Nine Regions.
Sacrificed as the God of the Altar, the Lord of the Five Lands.
The Five Lands are:
Mountains, rivers, marshes, ponds, hills, mounds, plains, and lowlands.
Far-reaching, vast, and moistening lands, the land is sealed and sacrificed to repay the merits of the land.
Unknown in which generation it was matched with Houtu.

10. The Divine Farmer Shennong Shi of the Yandi clan, surnamed Jiang.

He reigned for one hundred and forty years.
He was buried in Changsha.

The Shennong clan.ğŸ”½They cut wood to make plows.

They created sacrifices and rituals, and made the five-stringed zither.
It was patterned after the five elements.
From below, the emperors succeeded: Emperor Cheng, Emperor Lin, Emperor Kui, Emperor Ming, Emperor Zhi, Emperor Lai, Emperor Ai, and Emperor Yu.

For five hundred and forty years.
Eleventh, Dinghai: The Yellow Emperor, the Xiong clan, with the surname Gongsun, named Xuanyuan.

Born with spiritual intelligence.
At a young age, he could speak.ğŸ”½As a child, he was well-behaved.ğŸ”½As a youth, he was diligent and quick-witted.

The world all submitted.
Subduing tigers, leopards, and hyenas on the slopes.
There were eighty-one brothers of Chi You with copper heads and iron faces.
Eating sand and swallowing stones.
They are the essence of the mountains and seas.

Capable of crossing water.
Carts for sheltering.
Capable of traveling and living. Building houses and making coffins and shrouds to send off the dead.

Buried in the seventh month.

There were thirty-two wise men whose names and surnames are unknown. They dared to remonstrate. He ordered the flood to be controlled for nine years. He ordered Yu and Gun to control it. When the ten suns appeared simultaneously, he ordered Yi to shoot them.

The Rites say:
Mo means to cut the forehead and smear it with ink.

Gou means to cut off the nose.

are punished with this.
Zhu means to cut off the feet.
Those who breach the passes and cross city walls
are punished with this.
Gong means to castrate men and lock women in dark rooms.
Those who have illicit relations between men and women without propriety and righteousness
are punished with this.
The great punishment is the death penalty.

2. The Director of the Imperial Household was in charge of wine and food.

The dragon represents its transformation, symbolizing the sage's virtue. The colorful insect and pheasant represent its patterns. The ancestral tripod and ancestral vessels represent the tiger's stripes.

The cap with the sun and moon pattern represents filial piety. The water plants represent purity. The powdered rice represents nourishing people. The mountain represents precious stillness, taking its nature and not its power. The fire is round, taking its spirit and not its sharpness. White and black are called fu,
and the axe shape is taken to represent good judgment. Black and blue are called fu,
with the two characters facing away, representing its ability to discern.
Therefore, the cap with embroidered patterns was worn on the bingxu day of the month.
The god of agriculture was the son of Li Shan in ancient times.
The five grains are named after him.

From the Zhou dynasty onwards,
all were offered sacrifices to him.
The one who is in charge of the five grains,
sacrifices are offered to repay his merit.
The five grains are:
rice, wheat, beans, hemp, and barley.
They are divided into a hundred.

Qi of Song was the younger brother of King Zhou.
After King Wu conquered Yin,
Qi brought sacrificial vessels to the military camp.
He bared his flesh, faced down,
led a sheep on the left, held grass on the right,
and crawled forward on his knees.ğŸ”½King Wu then released Qi of Song.
He enfeoffed Wu Geng, the son of King Zhou, to continue the sacrifices of Yin.
He appointed the two uncles Guan and Cai to assist him.
When King Wu died,
Zhou Gong assisted King Cheng.
When Yin rebelled, the king ordered Wu Geng to be executed.
He then enfeoffed Qi to replace Yin as Song.

Duke Shu Yu of Jin, whose personal name was Zi Gan.
The son of Duke Wu.
Younger brother of King Cheng.

Shi Yi then requested to choose a day to establish Duke Shu Yu.
The king said:

Yi said:
The Son of Heaven has no jesting words.
Thus he was enfeoffed in Tang.
